jsx.ui
Class Component

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.Configurable
          jsx.Source
              jsx.ui.Widget
                  jsx.ui.Component
All Implemented Interfaces:
OnRender
public final class Component
extends Widget
implements OnRender

Defines components wrapping HTML or XML elements.

A component of this class uniquely wraps an underlying HTML or XML element. It is a Widget and can be wrapped by Widget to make more complex widgets.

Note that, components are Configurable and event sources which may fire Widget.Event high level events.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org

getRendered

public static final JsHTMLElement getRendered(Component e,
                                              OnRender on)

Gets the rendered element or adds rendering listener to the current component.

This method simply returns the underlying HTML element if the current component has been rendered.

Parameters:
e - The current component.
on - A rendering listener.
Returns:
The underlying HTML element or null if e is not rendered.
Since:
1.0

onEvent

public void onEvent(Render evt)

Performs an action on the dispatched event.

This method renders all the child components it has by calling the appendChild(Component, Component) method, which fires Render events from the child components and forces them to render their children accordingly.

Specified by:
onEvent in interface OnRender
Parameters:
evt - The event dispatched to this listener.
Since:
1.0

appendChild

public static final boolean appendChild(Component p,
                                        Component c)

Appends the child component to the parent component.

This method simply adds the child component to the children list of the parent component if the parent component has not been rendered. Otherwise, if the child component has been rendered, the method simply appends the child element to the parent element; if not, the method creates a new HTML element by inserting the HTML value to the parent element, updates cached styles of the child component and forces all of its children to render by firing a Render event from the newly rendered component.

Parameters:
p - The parent component.
c - The child component.
Returns:
true if the operation is successful; false, otherwise.
Since:
1.0

insertBefore

public static final boolean insertBefore(Component p,
                                         Component c,
                                         Component r)

Appends the child component to the parent component.

This method simply adds the child component to the children list of the parent component if the parent component has not been rendered. Otherwise, if the child component has been rendered, the method simply appends the child element to the parent element; if not, the method creates a new HTML element by inserting the HTML value to the parent element, updates cached styles of the child component and forces all of its children to render by firing a Render event from the newly rendered component.

Parameters:
p - The parent component.
c - The child component.
r - The reference component.
Returns:
true if the operation is successful; false, otherwise.
Since:
1.0

getById

public static final Component getById(java.lang.String id)

Gets a component wrapping an HTML element that has the specified id.

This method simply calls the Nodes.getElementById(String) method to find the element and then calls the get(JsElement) method to return a component for it.

Parameters:
id - The id of an HTML element.
Returns:
The component wrapping an HTML element that has the specified id.
Since:
1.0

get

public static final Component get(JsElement e)

Gets the component for an element.

The method simply returns the component that wraps the specified element if there is one. Otherwise, it creates one to wrap the element and returns the newly created component.

Parameters:
e - An underlying element.
Returns:
A component that wraps the specified element.
Since:
1.0

pageLeft

public final double pageLeft()

Computes and returns the X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the underlying element relative to the whole page.

This method has eliminated browser dependencies and is useful for components of absolutely positioned element move or resize according to mouse events that can only provide position data of page context.

Returns:
The X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the element wrapped by this component.
See Also:
pageTop()

pageTop

public final double pageTop()

Computes and returns the Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the underlying element relative to the whole page.

This method has eliminated browser dependencies and is useful for components of absolutely positioned element move or resize according to mouse events that can only provide position data of page context.

Returns:
The Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the element wrapped by this component.
See Also:
pageTop()

public static final void calculate(Component e)

Forces a component to recalculate its cached data of borders, margins, paddings, etc.

Parameters:
e - A component is to update its cache.
Since:
1.0

borders

public static final ArrayLike<java.lang.Double> borders(Component e)

Returns the widths of the left, right, top and bottom borders of a component as an array.

This method only returns the cached data. To update the cache of a component, use the calculate(Component) method.

Returns:
A list of border widths of the specified component.
Since:
1.0

offsetLeft

public static final double offsetLeft(Component e)

Gets the X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the CSS border of the underlying HTML element relative to its parent container element.

This method has eliminated browser dependencies, simply calling the Elements.offsetLeft(JsHTMLElement) method to get the JsHTMLElement.offsetLeft property of the underlying HTML element.

Parameters:
e - The current component.
Returns:
The X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the CSS border of the underlying HTML element relative to its parent container element.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
left(Component), offsetTop(Component), offsetWidth(Component), offsetHeight(Component)

offsetTop

public static final double offsetTop(Component e)

Gets the Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the CSS border of the underlying HTML element relative to its parent container element.

This method has eliminated browser dependencies, simply calling the Elements.offsetTop(JsHTMLElement) method to get the JsHTMLElement.offsetTop property of the underlying HTML element.

Parameters:
e - The current component.
Returns:
The Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the CSS border of the underlying HTML element relative to its parent container element.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
top(Component), offsetLeft(Component), offsetWidth(Component), offsetHeight(Component)

left

public static final double left(Component e)

Gets the X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the underlying HTML element relative to its parent container element.

Parameters:
e - The current component.
Returns:
The X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the underlying HTML element relative to its parent container element. It is the difference between the values returned from calling the offsetLeft(Component) and margin(Component, int) methods.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
top(Component), offsetLeft(Component)

top

public static final double top(Component e)

Gets the Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the underlying HTML element relative to its parent container element.

Parameters:
e - The current component.
Returns:
The T coordinate of the upper-left corner of the underlying HTML element relative to its parent container element. It is the difference between the values returned from calling the offsetTop(Component) and margin(Component, int) methods.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
left(Component), offsetLeft(Component)

                                double x)

offsetWidth

public static final int offsetWidth(Component e)

Gets the width, in pixels, of the underlying element and all its content, including the element's CSS padding and border, but not its margin.

This method has eliminated browser dependencies, simply calling the Elements.offsetWidth(JsHTMLElement) method to get the JsHTMLElement.offsetWidth property of the underlying HTML element.

Parameters:
e - The current component.
Returns:
The width, in pixels, of the underlying element and all its content, including the element's CSS padding and border, but not its margin.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
offsetLeft(Component), offsetTop(Component), offsetHeight(Component)

public static final int offsetHeight(Component e)

Gets the height, in pixels, of the underlying element and all its content, including the element's CSS padding and border, but not its margin.

This method has eliminated browser dependencies, simply calling the Elements.offsetHeight(JsHTMLElement) method to get the JsHTMLElement.offsetHeight property of the underlying HTML element.

Returns:

contentWidth

public static final double contentWidth(Component e)

Computes the content width of the underlying HTML element.

In IE, use offsetWidth(Component) for content width.

Parameters:
e - The current component.
Returns:
offsetWidth(Component) minus contentLeft(Component) and contentRight(Component).

1.0

createElement

public static final Component createElement(java.lang.String tagName)

Creates a new element in the current document with the specified tag name and returns a component that wraps the element.

This method simply calls the Elements.createElement(String) method to create an element and then calls the get(JsElement) method to return a component for it.

Parameters:
tagName - The tag name of the underlying opaque element node being created. Since HTML tags are case-insensitive, you may use any capitalization for HTML tag names. XML tag names are case-sensitive.
Returns:
The component that wraps the newly created opaque element.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - JavaScript throws a JsDOMException object with the JsDOMException.code property of the value JsDOMException.INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR if tagName contains an illegal character. See Js.err(Object) for JS Simulation.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
createElementNS(String, String), JsDocument.createElement(String), Elements.createElement(String)

createElementNS

public static final Component createElementNS(java.lang.String namespaceURI,
                                              java.lang.String qualifiedName)

Creates a new element with the specified tag name and name-space in the current document and returns a component that wraps the element.

This method simply calls the Elements.createElement(String) method to create an element and then calls the get(JsElement) method to return a component for it. It is just like createElement(String), except that the created element has a name and name space instead of just a name. This method is useful only with XML documents that use name spaces.

Parameters:
namespaceURI - The unique identifier for the name space of the new element or null for no name space.
qualifiedName - The qualified name of the new element. This should include a name space prefix, a colon, and a local name.
Returns:
A component that wraps the newly created element node with the specified tag name and name space.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - JavaScript throws a JsDOMException object with the JsDOMException.code property of the value JsDOMException.INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR if qualifiedName contains an illegal character, the value JsDOMException.NAMESPACE_ERR if qualifiedName is malformed or there is a mismatch between qualifiedName and namespaceURI, or the value JsDOMException.NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR if the implementation does not support XML documents and therefore does not implement this method. See Js.err(Object) for JS Simulation.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
createElement(String), JsDocument.createElementNS(String, String), Elements.createElementNS(String, String)

tagName

Returns the tag name of the underlying element of the current component.

Parameters:
e - The current component.
Returns:
The tag name of the underlying element of the current component.
Since:
1.0

tagName

public static final boolean tagName(Component e,
                                    java.lang.String tag)

Checks if the tag name of the underlying element of the current component matches the specified name.

Parameters:
e - The current component.
tag - A tag name.
Returns:
true if they match case-insensitively; false, otherwise.
Since:
1.0

getAttribute

public static final java.lang.String getAttribute(Component e,
                                                  java.lang.String name)

Returns the value of a named attribute of the underlying element as a string.

This method simply calls the Elements.getAttribute(JsElement, String) method with the underlying element and returns the value of a named attribute it has. Note that the JsHTMLElement objects have JavaScript properties that match each of the standard HTML attributes, so you need to use this method with HTML documents only if you are querying the value of nonstandard attributes.

In XML documents, attribute values are not available directly as element properties and must be looked up by calling this method. For XML documents that use name spaces, use getAttributeNS(Component, String, String).

Parameters:
e - The current component.
name - The name of the attribute whose value is to be returned.
Returns:
The value of the named attribute as a string. If the attribute is not defined, this method is supposed to return an empty string. Some implementations return null in this case, however.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
getAttributeNS(Component, String, String), JsElement.getAttribute(String), Elements.getAttribute(JsElement, String)

getAttributeNS

public static final java.lang.String getAttributeNS(Component e,
                                                    java.lang.String namespaceURI,
                                                    java.lang.String localName)

Returns the string value of an attribute of the underlying element specified by local name and name space URI.

This method simply calls the Elements.getAttributeNS(JsElement, String, String) method with the underlying element. It is useful only with XML documents that use name spaces and works just like the getAttribute(Component, String) method, except that the attribute is specified by a combination of name space URI and local name within that name space.

Parameters:
e - The current component.
namespaceURI - The URI that uniquely identifies the name space of this attribute or null for no name space.
localName - The identifier that specifies the name of the attribute within its name space.
Returns:
The value of the named attribute, as a string. If the attribute is not defined, this method is supposed to return an empty string, but some implementations return null instead.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
getAttribute(Component, String), JsElement.getAttributeNS(String, String), Elements.getAttributeNS(JsElement, String, String)

setAttribute

public static final void setAttribute(Component e,
                                      java.lang.String name,
                                      java.lang.Object value)

Sets or adds the named attribute of the underlying element to the specified string value.

This method simply calls the Elements.setAttribute(JsElement, String, Object) method with the underlying element and sets its specified attribute to the specified value. If no attribute by that name already exists, a new one is created.

Note that JsHTMLElement objects of an HTML document define JavaScript properties that correspond to all standard HTML attributes. Thus, you need to use this method only if you want to set a nonstandard attribute.

Parameters:
e - The current component.
name - The name of the attribute to be created or modified.
value - The string value of the attribute.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - JavaScript throws a JsDOMException object with the JsDOMException.code property of the value JsDOMException.NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR if the element is read-only and does not allow its attributes to be removed or the value JsDOMException.INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR if the name argument contains a character that is not allowed in HTML or XML attribute names. See Js.err(Object) for JS Simulation.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
setAttributeNS(Component, String, String, String), Elements.setAttribute(JsElement, String, Object), JsElement.setAttribute(String, Object)

setAttributeNS

public static final void setAttributeNS(Component e,
                                        java.lang.String namespaceURI,
                                        java.lang.String qualifiedName,
                                        java.lang.String value)

Sets or adds, to the list of attributes for the underlying element, an attribute with the specified a combination of local name and name space URI.

This method simply calls the Elements.setAttributeNS(JsElement, String, String, String) method with the underlying element. It is useful only with XML documents that use name spaces and works just like setAttribute(Component, String, Object) method, except that the attribute is specified by the combination of a name space URI and a local name defined within that name space.

Parameters:
e - The current component.
namespaceURI - The URI that uniquely identifies the name space of the attribute to be set or created, or null for no name space.
qualifiedName - The name of the attribute, specified as an optional name space prefix and colon followed by the local name within the name space.
value - The new value of the attribute.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - JavaScript throws a JsDOMException object with the JsDOMException.code property of the value JsDOMException.NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR if the element is read-only and does not allow its attributes to be removed, the value JsDOMException.INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR if qualifiedName argument contains a character that is not allowed in HTML or XML attribute names, the value JsDOMException.NAMESPACE_ERR if qualifiedName is malformed, or there is a mismatch between the name space prefix of qualifiedName and the namespaceURI argument, or the value JsDOMException.NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR if the DOM implementation of the browser does not support XML documents. See Js.err(Object) for JS Simulation.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
setAttribute(Component, String, Object), Elements.setAttributeNS(JsElement, String, String, String), JsElement.setAttributeNS(String, String, String)

removeAttribute

public static final void removeAttribute(Component e,
                                         java.lang.String name)

Removes the named attribute from the underlying element.

This method simply calls the Elements.removeAttribute(JsElement, String) method with the underlying element and deletes a named attribute from the element. If the named attribute has a default value specified by the document type, subsequent calls to this method return that default value. Attempts to remove nonexistent attributes or attributes that are not specified but have a default value are silently ignored.

Parameters:
e - The current component.
name - The name of the desired attribute.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - JavaScript throws a JsDOMException object with the JsDOMException.code property of the value JsDOMException.NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR if the element is read-only and does not allow its attributes to be removed. See Js.err(Object) for JS Simulation.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
removeAttributeNS(Component, String, String), Elements.removeAttribute(JsElement, String), JsElement.removeAttribute(String)

removeAttributeNS

public static final void removeAttributeNS(Component e,
                                           java.lang.String namespaceURI,
                                           java.lang.String localName)

Removes, from the underlying element, an attribute with the specified a combination of local name and name space URI.

This method simply calls the Elements.removeAttributeNS(JsElement, String, String) method with the underlying element. It is useful only with XML documents that use name spaces and works just like removeAttribute(Component, String) method, except that the attribute to be removed is specified by the combination of a name space URI and a local name defined within that name space.

Parameters:
e - The current component.
namespaceURI - The URI that uniquely identifies the name space of this attribute or null for no name space.
localName - The identifier that specifies the name of the attribute within its name space.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - JavaScript throws a JsDOMException object with the JsDOMException.code property of the value JsDOMException.NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR if the element is read-only and does not allow its attributes to be removed. See Js.err(Object) for JS Simulation.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
removeAttribute(Component, String), Elements.removeAttributeNS(JsElement, String, String), JsElement.removeAttributeNS(String, String)
